name: Illumination at Colborne Lodge: Christmas Ghost Stories
description:
As the year's longest night approaches, come gather indoors to share cold weather traditions from the past and present: holiday decorations, singing to lighten the heart and a live candle-lit reading of a unique genre of literature - the Victorian Christmas ghost story.

After a short tour of cozy Colborne Lodge and the singing of a seasonal song, the evening finishes with warm beverages, sweet treats and a live reading of a spooky seasonal story. 

Recommended for ages 8 and up. 8 to 16-year-olds must be accompanied by an adult ticketholder.

name: Orpheus Choir: Merry and Bright
description:
We are happy to reunite with the acclaimed Hannaford Street Silver Band to celebrate the holiday season in style. 

Hear your favourite holiday classics performed by combined choir and brass forces, with special guest soloist mezzo-soprano Alex Hetherington. 

A world premiere by Canadian-Haitian composer Christopher Ducasse will cap this festive and vibrant holiday feast for the senses and the soul!

name: Wing Chun Dance Drama
description:
Making its North American premiere, the globally celebrated masterpiece reveals the true story of Ip Man, the prestigious grandmaster of the martial art Wing Chun. The story recounts his influence on the martial art from its more than 300-year-old origins in Southern China, to global popularity, and his famous student Bruce Lee.

It features two gripping, inter-woven tales about the relentless pursuit of dreams while incorporating a pulse-pounding blend of acrobatic dance, precision martial arts and cinematic staging with dramatic lighting and breathtaking visuals. 

For audience members ages eight and up.

name: The Stop Good Food Market
description:
Good Food Markets increases access to high-quality, culturally-relevant, and affordable produce in neighbourhoods where it is often unavailable. These are places where farmers' markets aren't viable because sales are too low to cover farmers' costs. 

The GFM also connects customers to local Ontario farmers. On average, we source 57% of the GFM produce from Ontario, though this number varies widely with the seasons.

name: Messiah
description:
Toronto's grand holiday tradition! 

The trumpet shall sound and the heavenly voices of the Toronto Mendelssohn Choir and our magnificent soloists will transport you to a resplendent place of peace and beauty, an inspiring night of music to celebrate the season.

name: Kellylee Evans Winter Song
description:
JUNO-Award winning vocalist Kellylee Evans returns with her signature blend of jazz, R&B, and pop, just in time to welcome the festive season. 

Described by the Latin Jazz Network as having a "gorgeous voice [that] rises to the heavens in rapturous wonder as if in consanguinity with a chorus of angels," Evans is a performer whose artistry shines brightest live on stage.

In 2024, she released two acclaimed albums: Show Love, an innovative EP that builds new sonic ground while honouring the sounds of her previous six studio projects and Winter Song, a full-length celebration of holiday music that earned a 2025 JUNO nomination for Vocal Jazz Album of the Year.
